channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: A Ukrainian pop star escaped war in her home country to sing at South by Southwest, and to be a voice for those—including her bandmates—who stayed behind to fight https://t.co/Yq0EJuaefd
Rescuers haven’t found any survivors at the site in southern China where a China Eastern Airlines Boeing 737 crashed https://t.co/bsXGfrGMJF
Out of the NFL for five years, Colin Kaepernick has launched a renewed campaign to get signed. Does he have a chance? https://t.co/yURdkN8YUC
The U.S. secretly acquired Soviet air-defense weapons as part of a Pentagon intelligence program. Now it's sending them to Ukraine. https://t.co/co3yic3CjK
For years, many ranchers have blamed meatpacking giants for low cattle prices. Now, some cattlemen say they have a solution: Process the beef themselves. https://t.co/8U1YFMDg4L

From @WSJopinion: Team Biden doesn’t want to give the Ukrainians fighter jets, but why not send them as spare parts, asks @katebachwsj. Here’s a compromise that would salvage American credibility and show some ingenuity. https://t.co/2gILYF9St0
An FAA training specialist testified that a former Boeing pilot lied to her about how a 737 MAX flight-control system worked before two of the jets crashed https://t.co/HzzsREMKEW

From @WSJopinion: Healthy children don’t need Covid vaccines, writes @AllysiaFinley. Florida is right. Especially for kids under 12, the risks are trivial. And most have natural antibodies. https://t.co/E6hM0JOcyE

A new study found that people who recovered from Covid-19 within the past year were 40% more likely to receive a new diagnosis of diabetes compared to those who weren’t infected https://t.co/Qs7ozrz69A
The U.S. secretly acquired Soviet air-defense weapons as part of a Pentagon intelligence program. Now it's sending them to Ukraine. https://t.co/YSeMzXAfcr

Daddy Yankee, the reggaeton musician known for hits including “Gasolina” and “Despacito,” said that he plans to retire from music after a career that spanned more than three decades https://t.co/5d23zKs2o4

At her Supreme Court confirmation hearing, Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson said she hopes to carry on the spirit of Justice Stephen Breyer, for whom she had clerked and is now hoping to succeed https://t.co/LjgCBniRsQ

Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said the central bank is prepared to raise interest rates in half-percentage-point steps and high enough to deliberately slow the economy if it concludes such steps are warranted to bring inflation down https://t.co/JYwcqBNN10

Sen. Cory Booker (D., N.J.), one of just three Black senators, said he was joyous over Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson's historic nomination. "This is not a normal day for America, we have never had this day before," Mr. he said. https://t.co/TDHfQ7vFIb

The superyachts of Russia’s super rich have taken on outsize symbolism as targets of Ukraine-related sanctions. But while some luxury vessels have been seized at Europe’s ports, others made it to open water. https://t.co/mDFfOq0WDi
Support for an EU-wide ban on Russian oil is growing, diplomats say. It marks a major shift in Europe's stance on ratcheting up pressure on Moscow. https://t.co/kmvKljx7uk
From @WSJopinion: The U.S. has a formidable military. When Biden said he wouldn’t use it, Putin saw it as a green light, writes Nadia Schadlow. https://t.co/6B2dE3TQrL
A New Zealand couple hoped the 17-pound tuber they found in their garden would break the Guinness Record for a giant potato. DNA testing showed it wasn’t even a potato. https://t.co/03rKzD0R0A
Christie’s is asking $200 million for an iconic silkscreen portrait of Marilyn Monroe by Andy Warhol, a record asking price for any artwork at auction ever https://t.co/0EEZY2rjjy
Russia is shifting its strategy after faltering in Ukraine, U.S. officials say, seeking to compel Kyiv to accept its territorial claims and neutrality. https://t.co/Fey5KCODWx

The U.S. plans to boost military spending and increase its military presence near Russia in response to Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine, while trying to maintain a long-term focus on countering China https://t.co/wCUyLUXkk4
The U.S. secretly acquired Soviet air-defense weapons as part of a Pentagon intelligence program. Now it's sending them to Ukraine. https://t.co/mJXJnYQAGb
A China Eastern Airlines plane with about 130 people on board crashed in Guangxi province https://t.co/hVVEBuQk9U

Hong Kong will scrap flight bans from countries including the U.S. and shorten quarantine for some inbound travelers to seven days, a move that responds to concerns of business groups https://t.co/chIwO9pXGN
Elon Musk’s ties to China are causing concern in Washington, including among Republican lawmakers who have been some of the billionaire entrepreneur’s ardent supporters https://t.co/AvnyEInUly
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/V4rqfMG9N3 https://t.co/P5QkcDUyWg
Russia has inflicted heavy toll on Ukrainian port city of Mariupol, where fighting has reached the streets https://t.co/8LQNtyBJ4J
One lesson of history is that Russia’s conflicts starting abroad or on its borders sometimes end up shaking the country itself at its core https://t.co/imv6HHvs8E
The Russian Orthodox Church helped forge the ideology behind Putin’s war on Ukraine https://t.co/SD3r1m13Dd
It's important to adjust your workouts when you hit 50. Here are some exercises to help keep you strong and safe into the decades to come. https://t.co/0V5ARiIFo5
Ukraine’s military said early Sunday that Russian forces were largely busy replenishing losses in people and equipment with otherwise little movement by the invading army https://t.co/fI1mHx0uWT
Russia began the war in Ukraine with the world’s largest tank force but the losses it has suffered reveal its weaknesses on the modern battlefield https://t.co/C47Er77TZW
Recriminations and finger-pointing have begun in Russia’s spy and defense agencies, as Ukraine invasion has turned into a costly and embarrassing morass, U.S. officials say https://t.co/R1tT2sr104
A new Omicron variant dubbed BA.2 has been detected in the U.S. but scientists have yet to raise alarms. Here’s what we know so far. https://t.co/xhTC7Muihe
Russia is shifting its strategy after faltering in Ukraine, U.S. officials say, seeking to compel Kyiv to accept its territorial claims and neutrality. https://t.co/dyRhaxrGe8
The Biden administration sent Patriot missiles to Saudi Arabia, fulfilling Riyadh’s urgent request for a resupply amid bilateral tensions, U.S. officials said https://t.co/t6TUSj5t84

For some Ukrainian tech startups, the normal tasks of shipping code and ramping up sales have been replaced with mapping escape routes and paying colleagues fighting with the army https://t.co/CTS35f3tmV
From @WSJopinion: Ukraine is World War 2½, writes @DanHenninger. Virtually all of the world’s democracies have committed to repelling Russia. https://t.co/LlRFbAfIH1

Russia spent heavily to revamp its military. It has floundered in Ukraine, its first major test. “They have never had to operate these complex systems in this kind of conflict since at least the end of the Cold War.” https://t.co/bL0xpxCuug

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky criticized Israel’s refusal to send military aid and disparaged Israeli mediation efforts: “I want to point out that indifference kills. You can mediate between countries, but not between good and evil." https://t.co/mV2iOB5GKl
Recriminations and finger-pointing have begun in Russia’s spy and defense agencies, as Ukraine invasion has turned into a costly and embarrassing morass, U.S. officials say https://t.co/HH6CLooFbY

“We are in an aging society,” French President Emmanuel Macron said during his first press conference since declaring he would seek a second term. “It is therefore normal that we work more.” https://t.co/A0T7bgfESO
Our inboxes are mirrors—they reveal how we handle challenges. One full of unanswered emails doesn’t reflect well on its owner. https://t.co/IeddF9J8r3
Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has blocked grain exports and curtailed spring planting. Countries world-wide are now relying on a 2022 harvest that may never arrive. https://t.co/5o1tyN2l8x

Today’s headlines echo many wars in the Russian and Soviet past. History records tales of undersupplied Russian conscript soldiers, high inflation and industrial breakdowns during wartime, and tyrants surrounded by flatterers. https://t.co/iby2Ze587D
Elon Musk’s ties to China are causing concern in Washington, including among Republican lawmakers who have been some of the billionaire entrepreneur’s most ardent supporters https://t.co/8svDrFP7OA
NYU students spent nearly two months analyzing Taylor Swift’s songwriting, her feud with Kanye West and whether Jake Gyllenhaal has her scarf. https://t.co/Di2Djop3WH
The real story behind the Pentagon's program to secure biological labs in Ukraine https://t.co/6qKEhsutYt
“I’m working to sever my supply chain from Russia as fast as I can.” U.S. manufacturers with Russian ties are working to figure out how to survive. https://t.co/DK1Ar299QT

Russia’s assault on Ukraine has forced more than 10 million people to abandon their homes, the United Nations said. That means almost a quarter of the country’s prewar population has been uprooted. https://t.co/OMDdylUwxM
